name: Bilytica
title: Senior Data Analyst
Industry Skills: ['statistical analysis', 'data warehousing', 'data visualization', 'transform', 'statistics', 'data governance', 'project management', 'data analysis']
description: we are looking for a senior data analyst with 4 to 5 years of experience to join our team. the ideal candidate will possess strong expertise in power bi, dax, power query, and data analysis, complemented by excellent stakeholder management abilities. he will transform raw data into meaningful insights, develop interactive dashboards, and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. strong english communication skills are essential for this role to effectively convey complex data findings to diverse stakeholders. key responsibilities: utilize power bi to design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to stakeholders. apply dax (data analysis expressions) to create calculated columns, measures, and custom calculations to enhance data analysis capabilities. leverage power query to transform, clean, and prepare data from multiple sources for analysis and reporting. conduct thorough data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that can inform business strategies. collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and ensure data solutions align with business objectives. engage with stakeholders to present findings and recommendations, ensuring clarity and understanding of complex data concepts. document data processes, methodologies, and best practices for future reference and knowledge sharing. provide ongoing support and training to end-users on data visualization tools and data analysis techniques. qualifications: bachelor’s degree in data science, computer science, statistics, business administration, or a related field. proven experience in data analysis and visualization, preferably in a business or corporate environment. strong proficiency in power bi, dax, and power query. excellent analytical skills with a keen attention to detail. demonstrated ability to manage relationships with stakeholders at all levels. strong english communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to explain complex data concepts clearly and concisely. experience in project management and ability to work under tight deadlines. knowledge of sql and data warehousing concepts is a plus. preferred skills: familiarity with statistical analysis tools and techniques. experience with data governance and data quality best practices. ability to adapt to new technologies and tools as required. why join us: opportunity to work in a dynamic and collaborative environment. access to ongoing professional development and training. competitive salary and benefits package. job type: full-time job type: full-time

name: SolarWinds
title: Inside Sales Representative - Saudi Arabia
description: at solarwinds, we're a people-first company. our purpose is to enrich the lives of the people we serve—including our employees, customers, shareholders, partners, and communities. join us in our mission to help customers accelerate business transformation with simple, powerful, and secure solutions. the ideal candidate thrives in an innovative, fast-paced environment and is collaborative, accountable, ready, and empathetic. we're looking for individuals who believe they can accomplish more as a team and create lasting growth for themselves and others. we hire based on attitude, competency, and commitment. solarians are ready to advance our world-class solutions in a fast-paced environment and accept the challenge to lead with purpose. if you're looking to build your career with an exceptional team, you've come to the right place. join solarwinds and grow with us! your role: the inside sales representative is responsible for creating/developing new sales opportunities within a set of targeted accounts in saudi arabia. this is a highly collaborative role engaging with colleagues across the business, with a sales model that fosters collaboration and supports your success. this is a great opportunity to forge a successful sales career with a global leading software vendor. you will be based in riyadh, saudi arabia. your impact: to exceed monthly / quarterly sales targets by selling solarwinds solutions into targeted accounts. you will manage the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales, while also expanding existing accounts. territory/ vertical identification and research, to formalize a go to market strategy and create qualified target accounts. pipeline development through a combination of cold calling, email campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence. create and maintain a sales pipeline aligned with key coverage metrics, to ensure over-achievement within the role. engage with prospect organizations to position solarwinds solutions through strategic value-based selling, business case definition, roi analysis, references and analyst data. manage the end-to-end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as sales engineers, professional services, and executives. working closely with other cross-functional management teams in the marketing and product groups. in addition, manage the end-to-end sales process through the engagement of either a direct sales motion or working closely with a defined set of value adding resellers or system integrators, where appropriate generate short term results whilst maintaining a long-term perspective to maximize overall revenue generation. daily update of the salesforce system with accurate customer and pipeline data. accurate weekly and monthly forecasting and revenue deliver based in saudi arabia your experience: extensive, relevant experience of selling software solutions into large organizations, gained within a major software vendor or value-added reseller. successful history of net direct new business sales, with the ability to prove consistent delivery against targets. demonstrable track record of sales over achievement. credibility at all levels, including cxo. fluency in arabic and english language software sales relating to systems management and analysis, or vertical industry sector experience would be viewed favorably. solarwinds is an equal employment opportunity employer. solarwinds will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. all applications are treated in accordance with the solarwinds privacy notice: https://www.solarwinds.com/applicant-privacy-notice

name: Unipart Logistics
title: Planning Analyst
description: planning analyst riyadh, ksa competitive salary and benefits package about the job unipart logistics is proud to support saudi arabia’s vision for 2030, supporting growth in logistics and technology, providing opportunities for development and improvement. we would like you to join us as a planning analyst supporting the planning and coordination of various activities within the dc. as a planning analyst you’ll ensure planning processes run efficiently, resources are allocated effectively, and timelines are met. you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to help streamline and optimize planning efforts. as part of your key responsibilities you’ll: calculate production capacity based on provided 3m, (man, material & machine) and assist in the development and execution of plans, coordinating with relevant teams to ensure alignment and adherence to commitment and timelines allocate resources, including personnel dl & idl, to ensure the successful execution of dc operations and tasks maintain records of planning resource allocation, generate and distribute regular status reports to keep stakeholders informed of /dc operations progress analyse planning data to identify trends, potential bottlenecks, and areas for improvement contribute to data-driven decision-making by providing insights and recommendations facilitate communication and coordination among dc teams, ensuring that information flows efficiently. serve as a point of contact for planning-related inquiries and issues identify opportunities for process improvement within the planning department implement best practices to enhance efficiency and effectiveness analyse data to identify trends and key performance metrics customise reports to meet the specific needs of different departments, teams, or projects schedule and distribute reports to relevant stakeholders on a regular and ad-hoc basis, ensuring timely delivery develop and maintain a deep understanding of the business's strategic plans contribute to the development of technology roadmaps that support and enhance business goals analyse and problem-solve complex business challenges and propose effective solutions about you we’d love you to have the following skills and experience, but please apply if you think you’d be able to perform well in either of these roles! essential: excellent computer skills: excel, powerpoint presentation bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent work experience effective communication with team members, stakeholders, and vendors ability to identify and address planning-related challenges and provide effective solutions ability to adjust plans and strategies in response to changing circumstances strong team player with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams and departments efficiently manage tasks, prioritize work, and meet deadlines awareness of health & safety regulations, including manual handling good attention to detail able to work as part of a team desirable: previous experience in project planning, coordination, or a related role is a plus familiarity with data analysis and reporting tools

name: Norconsult Telematics
title: Saudi Arabia
description: id: 2273 | 10-15 yrs | saudi arabia | careers position objectives: the consultant will lead the development and implementation of strategies for comprehensive facility management, workplace design, and construction planning, this role aligns projects with the client’s long-term strategic objectives, ensuring optimized workplace environments, sustainable practices, and effective resource utilization, the consultant will guide key investment decisions and support strategic real estate plans while fostering cross-functional collaboration. job description & responsibilities: develop facility and construction strategies that align with the client’s long-term business goals and operational needs. conduct feasibility studies, including buy/rent evaluations, asset valuations, and assessments of operational workflows to inform investment decisions. collaborate with internal departments (e.g., it, security, hr) and external partners (e.g., municipal authorities, hse officials) to gather and document comprehensive facility requirements. translate business needs into actionable design specifications and strategic facility plans. lead the creation of high-level concept designs for modular, scalable, and sustainable facilities. ensure concept designs support efficient construction methods and future expansion needs. work with the strategic real estate financial analyst to incorporate financial modelling into facility planning, covering capex, opex, payback periods, and lifecycle costs. provide input on multi-year budget plans to align construction and facility management strategies with financial goals. ensure all designs and strategies adhere to local building codes, safety regulations, and sustainability standards. integrate hse and quality standards throughout the planning and implementation phases. act as the primary liaison between project teams, senior stakeholders, and external partners, facilitating clear communication and strategic alignment. manage cross-functional collaboration to ensure seamless integration of project objectives. introduce innovative, cost-effective solutions for optimizing workplace layouts and facility management practices. stay informed on global trends and incorporate facility and workplace design advancements into strategic plans. contribute to developing design guidelines, specifications, and contract negotiation strategies. review and provide input on project documentation, including tender and contract terms. qualifications & experience: bachelor’s or master’s degree in architecture, engineering, construction management, or a related field. 15 years of experience in strategic facility planning, workplace design, and construction management. proven experience in cross-functional project leadership and large-scale project delivery. demonstrated financial acumen and expertise in developing workplace and facility plans. pmp, leed, or other relevant certifications in project management or sustainable design are advantageous. experience in bim software, autocad, ms project, and erp systems. experience with data visualization tools like power bi and financial modelling software. strong strategic thinking, leadership, and excellent communication.

name: Nintex
title: IT Service Desk Analyst
description: about nintex: at nintex, we are transforming the way people work, everywhere. as the global standard for process intelligence and automation, we're trusted by over 10,000 public and private sector organizations across 90 countries. our customers, from industry giants like amazon, coca-cola, and microsoft, rely on the nintex platform to accelerate their digital transformation journeys by managing, automating, and optimizing business processes quickly and efficiently. we improve their lives through the technology we build. we are committed to fostering a workplace that supports amazing people in doing their very best work every day. collaboration is constant, our workplace is fun, the environment is fast-paced, and we value our people's curiosity, ideas, and enthusiasm. driven by passion and accountability, we take initiative, measure progress, and deliver results. our culture fosters innovation and problem-solving, fueled by curiosity and a commitment to thinking big. together, we move with agility, prioritize customer needs, and build unity through empathy, leaving a positive impact wherever we go. about the role: as part of the global it support team you will help provide a single point of contact to the enterprise for all technology related support needs. you will help fulfill daily support needs and maintain basic it operations as well as play a key role in our follow-the-sun support model that will take advantage of coverage across multiple time zones to provide timely service and support. you will be a point of escalation for complicated issues, lead or participate in it support projects and implementations and perform auditing activities to ensure accurate data is held in the various systems. your contribution will be: provide tier 1 support for enterprise end users for all technology related needs monitor ticketing system consistently and progress, escalate and resolve tickets efficiently using documented processes and critical thinking use incident classification guidelines to escalate high and critical priority tickets properly using the it incident management policy handoff any unfinished tickets to next support engineer on-shift assist with user onboarding procedures, including account setup, hardware setup/deployment, desk setup and user training manage our antivirus software to remove any active threats and ensure our endpoints are secure contribute to the global it support knowledge base by frequently updating, retiring and creating articles procure and configure required hardware for end-users support and maintain it-owned hardware, including proper decommissioning according to our soc2 requirements manage and track it assets using asset management system support and maintain av equipment in all areas of offices and externally as requested continuously improve support operations – analyzing operational data and use end user feedback to reduce downtime for end users, improve service turn time, and prevent end user incidents participate in team projects and provide timely and complete deliverables stay current with related technologies; recommend ways for nintex to improve productivity and reduce cost manage and lead projects for it support team, including participating in planning and execution of it projects and rollouts provide guidance and act as a level of escalation for others in the support team audit applications and systems (ad, asset management system, etc.) to analyze for compliance and changes that need to be made familiarize yourself with nintex products to help find ways that it support can leverage these systems to save time and cost to be successful, we think you need: what's in it for you? our people work in the way that best suits them and their teams - whether at home, in an office, or another place that sparks creativity, focus, and collaboration. our work environment is such that our people can successfully deliver their work while adequately supporting their lifestyle and preferences. while our offerings differ from country to country, we offer our entire global workforce an array of exciting perks and benefits, including global gratitude and recharge days flexible, paid time off policy employee wellness programs and counseling resources meaningful peer recognition and awards paid parental leave invention/patenting assistance community impact, paid volunteer time, and opportunities intercultural learning and celebration multiple tools through which to learn and grow, and an incredible global community view more about our benefits here: https://www.nintex.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/global-perks-and-benefits.pdf.

name: Qureos Inc
title: Finance reporting analyst - United Feed Co.
description: overview: united feed co. is a leading agricultural company that produces high-quality animal feed for livestock and poultry. we are currently seeking a talented and driven finance reporting analyst to join our dynamic finance team. the finance reporting analyst will be responsible for preparing, analyzing, and presenting financial reports to aid in decision-making and strategic planning. this is an exciting opportunity for a detail-oriented individual with a strong background in finance and reporting to join our growing company. key responsibilities: prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements conduct variance analysis against budget and forecast to identify trends and areas for improvement collaborate with various departments to gather and analyze financial data and ensure accuracy of information assist in the development of annual budgets and long-term financial plans monitor and report on key performance indicators (kpis) to senior management identify areas of inefficiency and work with management to implement cost-saving measures ensure compliance with accounting principles and company policies stay updated on industry trends and regulations related to financial reporting qualifications: bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or related field minimum of 3 years of experience in finance and reporting, preferably in a similar industry strong knowledge of financial reporting standards and principles advanced proficiency in microsoft excel and other financial software excellent analytical and problem-solving skills detail-oriented with the ability to work independently and meet strict deadlines strong communication and interpersonal skills ability to handle confidential information with integrity and discretion valid socpa certificate

name: DSV
title: Senior Logistics Engineer
description: if you are a current dsv employee and interested in a position in another country, please contact your human resource representative to discuss the process and requirements of applying. job req number: 88167 time type: full time role summary: as senior logistics engineer, you will play a critical role in optimizing and enhancing the logistics and supply chain operations of the company. this role involves analyzing and designing efficient distribution networks, improving transportation strategies, and implementing technology solutions to enhance overall operational efficiency and customer satisfaction. responsibilities: analyze existing logistics processes, distribution networks, and supply chain operations to identify opportunities for improvement. design and propose optimized logistics solutions that enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and improve service levels. develop and implement transportation strategies that optimize routing, scheduling, and carrier selection to minimize transit times and costs. identify modes of transportation that align with business requirements and market trends. design, model, and optimize logistics and distribution networks to ensure optimal inventory placement and reduce lead times. collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement network changes and improvements. identify and evaluate technology solutions, such as founders, and robust funding to propel startups to unicorn status. leveraging a blend of industry, technology, and startup expertise, we generate and evaluate visionary ideas, and take them from idea the financing they need. about the role: we are seeking a skilled quantitative credit analyst to join our dynamic team. the successful candidate will be responsible for developing and implementing quantitative models to assess and manage credit risk, ensuring the robustness and scalability of our credit products. this role requires a deep understanding of credit risk modeling, data analysis, and the fintech landscape in saudi arabia. key responsibilities: credit risk modeling: develop, validate, and maintain quantitative models for credit risk assessment, including probability of default (pd), loss given default (lgd), and exposure at default (ead) models. data analysis: analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform credit decision-making processes. model implementation: collaborate with software developers to integrate credit risk models into the company's platforms, ensuring seamless functionality and performance. risk assessment: conduct thorough analyses of credit applications, evaluating the creditworthiness of potential clients and making data-driven recommendations. regulatory compliance: ensure all credit risk models and processes comply with local regulatory requirements and industry best practices. reporting: prepare detailed reports and presentations on credit risk assessments, model performance, and portfolio analytics for stakeholders and senior management. qualifications: education: bachelor's or master's degree in finance, economics, statistics, mathematics, or a related quantitative field. experience: minimum of 5+ years of experience in credit risk modeling or quantitative analysis within the financial services or fintech industry. technical skills: proficiency in statistical and programming languages such as python, r, or sas. experience with data visualization tools and databases is a plus. analytical skills: strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail. communication: excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. regulatory knowledge: familiarity with saudi arabian financial regulations and the fintech landscape is highly desirable. preferred qualifications: certifications: professional certifications such as cfa, frm, or prm are advantageous. industry knowledge: understanding of the fintech ecosystem and emerging trends in digital lending and credit assessment. additional information for us, conscious business is a top priority. we are a carbon neutral company with a science-based environmental strategy. in addition to that, stryber is an equal opportunity employer. we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations in which we operate. stryber will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

compliance and regulatory testing validate that banking applications comply with regulatory requirements and standards requirements bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field. proven experience as a quality assurance (qa) tester, preferably in the banking industry. strong knowledge of software testing principles, methodologies, and tools. experience with test management tools, such as jira or testrail, etc strong analytical and problem-solving skills. excellent communication and collaboration skills. attention to detail and ability to maintain high levels of accuracy. experience with test automation tools is a plus.

developing requirements for applications, local area networks (lans), wide area networks (wans), virtual private networks (vpns), routers, firewalls, and related security and network devices; designs public key infrastructures (pkis), including use of certification authorities (cas) and digital signatures as well as hardware and software; identifying security gaps; evaluating and implementing enhancements design of overarching global security framework, operating model and strategy including related policies and processes implement it security policies in accordance with applicable laws, standards and regulations communicate framework, strategy and policies to all relevant internal and external parties education bachelor’s degree in a computing/it field. master’s degree preferred. experience minimum 15 years of experience with exposure to general system administration; experience and knowledge in securing technical platforms; experience and knowledge of it systems/data security as it relates to the cloud environment; understanding of regulations and best practices for technical deployments in a cloud/datacenter environment and healthcare industry; knowledge of information security standards (e.g., iso 27001/27002, etc.), rules and regulations related to information security and data confidentiality (e.g., hipaa, hitech, hitrust, etc.); experience and knowledge in secure server and workstation deployment and support; strong communication skills (written, verbal, and listening); general understanding of networking and telecommunications; ability to learn quickly and maintain a diverse workload in a fast-paced environment; description: who are we❓ welcome to the world of mrsool! where on-demand delivery meets unparalleled user needs to deliver anything you desire. as one of the largest delivery platforms in the middle east and north africa (mena) region, mrsool has captivated users with its unique and seamless experience, earning it the highest ratings among all major delivery platforms on both apple's app store and google's play store. what sets mrsool apart is its commitment to providing an unmatched "order anything from anywhere" experience. this extraordinary feat is made possible by our extensive fleet of dedicated on-demand couriers. with their unwavering dedication, they ensure that your desired items reach your doorstep, no matter where you are. whether it's a late-night craving, a forgotten item, or a special gift for a loved one, mrsool is here to deliver, quite literally. we take pride in the convenience we offer, empowering you to get what you need when you need it, all at the tap of a button. the job in a nutshell we are seeking an experienced senior data scientist to join our dynamic team and take ownership of data-driven insights, leading analytical initiatives that shape the future of our product offerings. this role will involve close collaboration with cross-functional teams to enhance business decisions, improve operational efficiencies, and unlock new revenue streams. if you're eager to take on this rewarding opportunity, we’d love to hear from you. apply today! what you will do develop and lead data science projects from concept to deployment, ensuring alignment with business goals. act as a thought leader within the organization, guiding data-driven decisions across product development, operations, and marketing. build, refine, and deploy machine learning models to solve a variety of business challenges, such as demand forecasting, user behavior prediction, delivery route optimization, and customer segmentation. leverage statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and optimization techniques to drive insights from complex data sets. work closely with product, engineering to understand their needs, provide actionable insights, and drive improvements in our delivery platform. present and communicate data insights and models to senior leadership in a clear, concise manner. partner with data engineers to ensure robust data pipelines and a scalable data infrastructure. identify and implement new tools, libraries, or platforms to enhance our data capabilities. provide guidance and mentorship to junior data scientists and analysts, helping to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. requirements what are we looking for❓ master’s or ph.d. in data science, computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related field. 5+ years of experience in data science roles, with a proven track record of leading large-scale projects from ideation to execution. expertise in machine learning algorithms (e.g., supervised, unsupervised, deep learning) and statistical methods (e.g., regression analysis, hypothesis testing). proficiency in python, r, sql, and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., tableau, power bi). experience working with large datasets and cloud platforms (e.g., aws, google cloud, or azure). strong business acumen with the ability to translate complex analyses into strategic insights. excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels. proven leadership abilities with experience in mentoring and developing teams. who will excel❓ experience in the delivery or logistics industry. familiarity with optimization techniques for routing and scheduling. knowledge of experimentation frameworks (e.g., a/b testing) and causal benefits what we offer you❗ inclusive and diverse environment: we foster an inclusive and diverse workplace that values innovation and provides flexibility. whether you prefer remote, in-office, or hybrid work arrangements, we accommodate your needs. competitive compensation: our compensation packages are competitive and include potential share options for certain roles. personal growth and development: we are committed to your professional development, offering regular training and an annual learning stipend to help you advance your career in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. autonomy and mentorship: you’ll enjoy a degree of autonomy in your role, supported by mentorship and ambitious goals that drive both your personal success and the company's growth.

name: EY
title: Manager Transfer Pricing - ITTS - KSA - Al Khobar
description: the international tax and transaction services (itts) practice is comprised of three competencies focused on advising corporate and private equity clients on all aspects of their capital agenda – transaction tax advisory, international corporate tax advisory and transfer pricing. itts is unique in that it is a joint venture between the transaction advisory services and tax service lines allowing itts to maximize market opportunities as well as the growth and development of itts professionals. the transactions market is a major part of ey’s market strategy and a huge opportunity for the business and ey professionals. the transfer pricing (tp) competency addresses planning, documentation and controversy issues associated with all types of intercompany transactions, assisting companies with supply chain matters, with a particular focus on intangible property, and helping companies accurately reflect and monitor their transfer pricing in their financial systems. with this many service offerings, you will have the opportunity to participate in cross competency trainings to help develop your career through a broad scope of engagements, mentoring and formal learning. the opportunity constantly changing regulatory environments have led to rapid growth in the area of transfer pricing. ey is a leader in synthesizing global developments and advising our clients. you’ll see that reflected in your career, as you’ll be working with prestigious global clients at the leading front of economic analysis. whether you’ve built your skills in another global organization, you’re approaching this from an industry perspective, or you’ve recently completed a b.a., master’s or phd and are interested in applying your analytical skills, you could really shine here. your key responsibilities you’ll be heavily involved at all stages of the project life cycle, making this a high-profile opportunity to take on a wide range of responsibilities and diversify your skills and experience. it’s all about translating information from a variety of sources into quantitative and qualitative analyses to inform and advise our clients. that will include building relationships with clients in a spectrum of industries and getting to know their unique needs and aspirations to provide tailored global services. it will also mean demonstrating your leadership by supervising multiple transfer pricing engagements and contributing to the delivery of quality tax planning services for our diverse clients. skills and attributes for success applying complex transfer pricing concepts and economic/financial knowledge to resolve client challenges providing a fully integrated approach to transfer pricing by preparing documents and assisting in defending transfer pricing in audits supplying innovative transfer pricing and economic ideas, alongside responsive services and work products modelling financial outcomes, valuing intangible assets and developing practical planning approaches coordinating work with other client service colleagues globally to drive collaboration to qualify for the role, you must have a bachelor’s degree in business, finance, economics, management, policy analysis or another relevant discipline and a minimum of 5 years of related work experience a master’s, law degree, cpa, chartered financial analyst (cfa), american society of appraiser's business valuation certification or certified management accountant (cma) excellent verbal and written communication skills the ability to work at a fast-pace, often with shifting responsibilities ideally, you’ll also have a phd in a relevant discipline a consistent record of excellence in a professional services environment existing transfer pricing experience what we look for we’re interested in experienced tax professionals with a collaborative, client-focused approach to work. you’ll need strong communication skills, and the ability to effectively prioritize when working with multiple clients and engagement teams. if you’re a naturally curious problem solver with confidence to get involved and support colleagues and clients across the business, this role is for you. what we offer we offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. plus, we offer: continuous learning: you’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. success as defined by you: we’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. transformative leadership: we’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. diverse and inclusive culture: you’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. if you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. the exceptional ey experience. it’s yours to build. ey | building a better working world ey exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. enabled by data and technology, diverse ey teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate. working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, ey teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

insights. strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. experience in the medtech industry is a must. click on apply if this sounds name: Qureos Inc

description: overview: al hokair group is a name that has been tied the world of hospitality and entertainment for decades. to many, it has become the first name that comes to mind when tourism in saudi arabia or the arabian world are mentioned. the group was started in 1975 to invest in the sectors of entertainment and hospitality under the leadership of sheikh abdulmohsin al hokair. over five decades, the group's projects expanded to include 70 entertainment centers and 33 hotels spread in saudi arabia and united arab emirates. the group continues to develop its tourism investments to deliver the best of what top global companies offer by attracting expertise and establishing partnerships that enhance returns of investment and makes a difference in the fields of entertainment and hospitality. job summary: the financial analyst is responsible for analyzing financial data and providing insights to support decision-making processes within the organization. this role involves preparing financial reports, forecasting future financial performance, and conducting variance analysis to identify trends and discrepancies. the financial analyst will collaborate with various departments to ensure financial goals are met and provide recommendations for improving financial performance. key responsibilities: conduct financial analysis and prepare reports on current and historical financial data analyze financial performance and identify trends, variances, and opportunities for improvement develop and maintain financial models to support forecasting and budgeting processes monitor and report on financial kpis to senior management collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze financial data for projects and initiatives assist in the preparation of annual budgets and forecasts conduct market research and stay updated on industry trends and competitors’ financial performance participate in the evaluation of potential investments and acquisitions ensure compliance with financial policies, procedures, and regulations provide ad-hoc financial analysis and support to management as needed qualifications: bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or related field minimum of 3 years of experience in financial analysis or similar role strong knowledge of financial principles and concepts proven experience in financial modeling and data analysis proficient in microsoft excel and other financial software excellent written and verbal communication skills ability to work independently and in a team environment strong attention to detail and accuracy high level of confidentiality and integrity knowledge of the retail or entertainment industry is a plus professional certification (cfa, cpa, etc.) is a plus we offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as opportunities for growth and career development within our dynamic and diverse organization. if you are a driven and analytical individual with a passion for financial analysis and a desire to contribute to the success of a leading company, then we encourage you to apply for the position of financial analyst at al hokair group.

name: Urbi

description: we are urbi, and we create a ready-to-use digital platform with geospatial data, map visualisation and analysis tools, transport routing, and geo-coding algorithms. urbi platform can be customized for any business needs, cloud-native or on-premise usage. we have a big international team which innovates, creates, and brings niche products to solve any business challenges related to mapping, location data, navigation, and spatial analysis to the mena region. the accuracy of data is our priority- and now we are now looking for gis quality control specialist/data analyst to join our team in madinah. what you are going to do: conduct quality control assessments on data collection, ensuring adherence to project specifications and urbi standards; follow-up on data sheets such as road surveying data sheets and data collection sheets for each project; work on fiji & ir for extracting and analyzing data; collaborate with the supervisors to identify and rectify data discrepancies and errors; provide insights and recommendations to improve data collection and processing workflows. our expectations: data analyst background or similar with at least 2 to 3 years of experience; gis experience would be a plus; strong knowledge of main data analysis software (powerbi & dashboards, advanced excel, macros) ; ready to join within max 1 month notice period - before is more favorable; proficiency in english&arabic. from our side: competitive salary package based on skills and experience; opportunity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic technology company; collaborate with a diverse and talented team of professionals; comprehensive benefits package. sounds interesting? we really want to get to know you, so make sure you tell us why you would be a good fit for this role. job type: full-time language: arabic (preferred) location: medina (preferred)

name: Master-Works

requirements bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field minimum 3 years of experience in data quality analysis or a similar role strong knowledge of data quality methodologies, techniques, and best practices proficiency in sql and experience with data analysis tools familiarity with data profiling and cleansing tools (e.g., informatica, talend) understanding of data governance and data management practices excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills strong attention to detail and ability to work effectively with large datasets excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

name: Savills Middle East
title: Analyst – Real Estate Consultancy
description: savills is looking for a motivated and innovative professional to join our growing strategic consultancy team. in this role, you will not only develop your expertise but also play a pivotal part in expanding our consultancy offering. as a trusted advisor within our business, you’ll be the go-to contact for all ad-hoc real estate consultancy requests, while taking the lead in preparing compelling pitches and tenders. your insights and strategic thinking will help shape detailed analyses and comprehensive real estate studies for key mandates across ksa. savills is a globally recognised real estate brand and offers the opportunity for growth and development. we are looking for a professional individual with an interest in benefiting from the support and experience the brand can offer. key responsibilities conduct comprehensive primary and secondary research to analyze real estate markets, assessing supply, demand, and performance across various components. build and maintain a supply-demand database for multiple geographies, tracking existing projects, market demand, and future pipeline developments. perform market segmentation for different asset classes (e.g., residential, retail, office, hotels, industrial) and prepare benchmark templates for comparable projects. analyze macroeconomic and property market trends, and compile detailed reports covering site analysis, market outlook, financial projections, and development plans. collaborate on enhancing savills' data collection and analysis program and contribute to broader team projects within the global business. develop presentations for internal and external audiences, while also supporting senior leadership in preparing presentations and project proposals. provide ongoing, high-quality support to both internal teams and external clients, staying updated on market trends and contributing to business development efforts. skills, knowledge and experience candidates with prior experience at big 4 or advisory firms are preferred, though fresh graduates with a strong interest in financial advisory and consultancy are encouraged to apply. proficient in ms powerpoint, excel, word, outlook, and skilled in data management, including creating charts, maps, and other visual tools. strong understanding of real estate dynamics, including supply-demand trends and performance tracking, with the ability to apply this knowledge in various projects excellent interpersonal skills to communicate effectively with colleagues, clients, and stakeholders at all levels. fluent in english and arabic, with exceptional written and verbal communication skills in both languages. confident and diplomatic when delivering reports and presentations to diverse audiences. self-driven with the ability to work independently, take initiative, and maintain a proactive, positive attitude. detail-oriented and focused on delivering precise, high-quality work. a team player with a strong willingness to learn and contribute to the success of the broader team.

technologies. we are interested in leaders with entrepreneurial mindset, who are accountable for their business results, and can help grow a new generation of talents within the organization. what we name: AtkinsRéalis
title: Risk Analyst
description: join us in engineering a better future for our planet and its people. atkinsréalis is a world-leading design, engineering and project management organization. we connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. together, with our industry partners and clients, and our global team of consultants, designers, engineers and project managers, project team based in madinah, saudi arabia. develop and monitor a risk issue and opportunity management process. develop and maintain a risk matrix identifying dependencies and the impacts of not meeting scheduled dates. identify, monitor and managing dependencies, and for resolving related issues. identify opportunities to arrange and co-ordinate any necessary discussions and agreements to realise benefits. monitor projects and ensure that an adequate and robust risk management process is under active management. implement risk management plan, risk log, and associated governance process. track significant risks to ensure that they are being systematically identified, recorded, evaluated, actively managed and regularly re-evaluated, and communicated across the program. identify, communicate, and manage inter-program or external risks. identify and manage internal program-related risks. review and update risk log against program status reports & meetings requirements qualifications with a minimum of 10 years experience in risk management and has background in construction/engineering industry graduate in engineering / business or equivalent postgraduate qualifications or equivalent risk management qualification or equivalent would be preferred. essential criteria understanding and experience of complex projects strong leadership, communication, and management skills track record of risk management location this role will be based in the kingdom of saudi arabia responsibilities in addition, the client wishes to achieve the following objectives: provide accurate and timely management information on a regular basis on the status of various projects to monitor progress and drive delivery of individual projects, challenging and accelerating these where appropriate to enable management of risks and opportunities at the programme level to drive commonality and coherence between the various projects to ensure the interdependencies between various projects is understood and managed to ensure appropriate standards are set and adhered to legally and commercially to ensure the client is obtaining value for money through negotiations with suppliers develop the capacity of the client through the transfer of knowledge, skills and abilities implement best practice program, project and other management and administrative processes benefits benefits are commensurate with working in kingdom of saudi arabia why choose atkinsréalis your difference makes a difference. we care for our people and are committed to creating an inclusive working environment where you can thrive and build a future you want to be a part of. thrive with us. when you join us, your wellbeing, health and safety become our top priority. engineering the future with digital. from design and engineering to project management, digital is fundamental to our way of working. champion lasting change. we build sustainability into everything we do. rewards and benefits to point of origin. employee wellbeing programme – 24 hour free advice on financial, legal and family care specialists and also access to personal health, fitness and nutrition consultants atkinsréalis is committed to eliminating discrimination and encouraging diversity amongst our workforce. we aim to provide quality and fairness for all job applicants and employees and not to complying with the relevant employment legislation and codes of practice. ensuring that all existing employees, potential employees, colleagues and customers are treated equally and with respect.

name: JASARA PMC
title: Performance & Reporting Analyst
description: jasara pmc is looking for a detail-oriented performance & reporting analyst to join our dynamic team. in this role, you will be responsible for analyzing project performance metrics and creating comprehensive reports to provide insights into operational efficiency and effectiveness. your role will be vital in driving data-informed decision-making processes and enhancing project delivery within the organization. as a performance & reporting analyst, you will work closely with various project teams to gather data, monitor performance indicators, and generate reports that highlight trends and areas for improvement. this position offers a unique opportunity to contribute to transformative projects across saudi arabia. responsibilities analyze performance data to identify trends, variances, and anomalies. create and present regular reports and dashboards for various stakeholders. collaborate with project teams to ensure accurate data collection and reporting. support the development and implementation of performance metrics and kpis. assist in identifying opportunities for continuous improvement in reporting and performance processes. stay abreast of industry best practices and emerging trends in performance analysis and reporting. requirements education: bachelor's degree in business administration, engineering, or a related field. experience: minimum of 7 years of experience in performance analysis or reporting roles. technical competencies: strong proficiency in reporting tools such as microsoft excel, power bi, or tableau. solid understanding of performance metrics, kpis, and analysis techniques. excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail. strong communication skills, both verbal and written. ability to work collaboratively and independently in a fast-paced environment.

name: Master-Works
title: Sr. Business Analyst / Data Steward
description: job summary: we are seeking an experienced sr. business analyst / data steward to join our team. this role is critical in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions, with a strong focus on data governance and management. the ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring data quality, consistency, and availability across the organization, while driving business analysis to support data-driven decision-making. key responsibilities: collaborate with business and it teams to understand data requirements and align them with business objectives. lead efforts to maintain and improve data quality, including establishing data governance processes. act as a key stakeholder in data stewardship activities, ensuring compliance with data standards and policies. analyze business processes and identify opportunities for improvement through data solutions. work closely with data engineers and analysts to support data integration, reporting, and analytics initiatives. provide expertise in the development of business intelligence solutions, dashboards, and reports. qualifications: strong experience in data stewardship and business analysis, with a focus on data governance. proven ability to collaborate across departments and lead cross-functional teams. excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail. proficiency in data management tools and technologies. bachelor's degree in business, it, data science, or related field.

name: Mrsool
title: Principal, Product - Consumer App - Remote
description: who are we❓ welcome to the world of mrsool! where on-demand delivery meets unparalleled user needs to deliver anything you desire. as one of the largest delivery platforms in the middle east and north africa (mena) region, mrsool has captivated users with its unique and seamless experience, earning it the highest ratings among all major delivery platforms on both apple's app store and google's play store. what sets mrsool apart is its commitment to providing an unmatched "order anything from anywhere" experience. this extraordinary feat is made possible by our extensive fleet of dedicated on-demand couriers. with their unwavering dedication, they ensure that your desired items reach your doorstep, no matter where you are. whether it's a late-night craving, a forgotten item, or a special gift for a loved one, mrsool is here to deliver, quite literally. we take pride in the convenience we offer, empowering you to get what you need when you need it, all at the tap of a button. the job in a nutshell we are looking for a senior/principal product manager (all genders) to join our tech teams and help create an amazing customer delivery experience. our android, ios and web apps help connect riders, restaurants and customers, to facilitate deliveries, and this has a direct impact on the work and lives of users around the world. the senior/principal pm role at mrsool has an extremely high social and business impact, and like any such role, it’s naturally gratifying and fulfilling from a career growth perspective but also comes with large responsibilities. as a customer-centric product manager, you will develop features that solve real problems and generate business impact, whilst partnering up with stakeholders such as engineering, design, operations and executive management. the wide customer base for this product portfolio (real-life users, riders, restaurants, other engineering teams) means this role will expose you to a wide range of related topics, almost all of them of critical importance to the business. working with your own team, but often in collaboration with other tech teams, you will serve as an internal/external liaison between engineering, design, operations, and executive management, building tech solutions that power products which in turn serve millions of customers. the primary part of this role will be to define and execute mrsool’s product strategy and vision for search experience. we are building a proposition we believe customers will be excited by and driving growth of our product through several big investments in customer experience. you'll be the valued expert and custodian of the end to end app journey across all aspects of search. this will include customer experience - ensuring a personalised, dynamic and friction-free experience, monitoring and upholding high quality, performance and stability goals; and search platform - reducing dependencies on legacy tech and supporting developers with making the right choices to build a scalable, fast, best-in-class search stack. the role is based in our riyadh headquarters and offers visa sponsorship. what you will do define product strategy, roadmap and backlog for search and drive meaningful impact for the customer and business by delivering on them successfully and quickly across the customer journey identify, conceptualise and develop new features and products, that deliver clear business impact. do it in a customer-oriented way, with quality in mind, and prioritise what’s best for the company based on specific goals and impact. be a leader in championing your product across all stakeholders, internal and external, including regional country teams, marketing etc. develop, lead and implement projects such as company-wide go-to-market plans. ensure timely delivery of projects in collaboration with other departments and functions. communicate effectively with key stakeholders, uncovering problem spaces on the ground and informing new product features that solve for local users and local businesses. work collaboratively with business stakeholders, assisting and troubleshooting to ensure that products are competitive and marketable. collaborate with engineers and designers, and other colleagues sharing knowledge on product developments and issues, to discuss and implement effective solutions for the team. perform a/b testing working with product analysts and data scientists to validate and iterate product increments that demonstrate customer and business value. gather and use quantitative and qualitative data, creating hypotheses and making informed product decisions, testing assumptions early to reduce risk up-front. conducting/facilitating market and competitor research with adjacent functions (e.g. design, ops etc.) help train, mentor and upskill other pms to elevate their skills and to increase your impact across the organisation. requirements what are we looking for❓ minimum of 7 years of prior experience working in a pm role (bonus if within the mobility or geo-mapping industries). previous experience in conceptualizing b2c product solutions, engaging with business stakeholders. experience in working on mobile-first experiences with android or ios engineers. ability to get hands-on in a complex operational environment, to manage and close the loop on multiple concurring tasks - all whilst building healthy relationships with stakeholders. experience with lean and agile methodologies and processes (e.g. sprints, kanban etc.) data-driven and impact-oriented; comfortable in analysing, reporting and efficiently formulating insights from quantitative and qualitative data. proven experience in developing and maintaining good relationships with key stakeholders, partners and executive management. knowledge of design thinking methodologies to create outstanding user experiences with the help of ux or product designers. bsc or msc degree (or equivalent) benefits what we offer you❗ inclusive and diverse environment: we foster an inclusive and diverse workplace that values innovation and provides flexibility. whether you prefer remote, in-office, or hybrid work arrangements, we accommodate your needs. competitive compensation: our compensation packages are competitive and include potential share options for certain roles. personal growth and development: we are committed to your professional development, offering regular training and an annual learning stipend to help you advance your career in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. autonomy and mentorship: you’ll enjoy a degree of autonomy in your role, supported by mentorship and ambitious goals that drive both your personal success and the company's growth.

name: Schlumberger
title: Early Careers - Field Operations
description: job description about slb we are a global technology company, driving energy innovation for a balanced planet. together, we create amazing technology that unlocks access to energy for the benefit of all. at slb, we recognize that our innovation, creativity, and success stem from our differences. we actively recruit people with a diverse range of backgrounds and cultivate a culture of inclusion that unlocks the benefits of our diversity. we want to ensure that everyone feels a sense of belonging here and we encourage, enable, and empower our people to foster inclusivity, build trust, and demonstrate respect for all across the organization. global in outlook, local in practice - and with a united, shared passion for discovering solutions, we hire talented, driven people and support them to succeed, personally and professionally. join the frontier of energy innovation. in a range of career paths, you’ll gain real experience on-site while using your expertise to deliver leading tech solutions. as a field engineer, you will be involved in every part of our business. from acquiring essential data to planning long-term well development, you will organize, run, and report operations in the field environment and assist specialists and other engineers with key decisions. your training will be hands-on as you learn about the energy industry and become an expert in the various tools and services in your business line. with the help of management and a comprehensive development program, you will be given responsibility and support to make your impact and start becoming a leader in our business. our field specialists focus on the vital technical and operational procedures that ensure our sites are safe and our customers get exceptional service. you will receive intensive instruction in troubleshooting, safety, and client interaction to develop a deep technical understanding of what we do. through a combination of hands-on learning and formal training, you will become the company’s representative on-site, with supervisory responsibility, working through a range of complex, practical challenges and developing innovative strategies to solve description: role and responsibilities: the product/business analyst will collaborate closely with product managers, product designers, development teams, and key stakeholders to provide actionable insights and support decision-making processes. key responsibilities include: monitoring product and feature performance, establishing success metrics, and optimizing based on findings. analyzing market data to identify customer behavior and trends. supporting the design and evaluation of a/b tests to enhance user experiences. developing self-service and user-friendly analytics dashboards for effective decision-making. conducting quantitative analysis of user behavior to uncover issues or opportunities to improve customer experience. informing the design and analyzing the outcomes of in-app tests and experiments. collaborating across ux teams and business functions to infuse strategic, open-ended research with quantitative insights. skills and experience required: a bachelor's degree in computer science, math, statistics, economics, or a related field. at least 4 years of experience in a product analytics team. proficiency in sql and experience with modern bi tools, preferably metabase. expertise in product analytics tools like amplitude, google analytics, or datadog. strong multitasking and problem-solving skills. effective communication skills, capable of interacting with stakeholders at various levels.

name: Boston Consulting Group
title: Senior Analyst - Customer Insights & Analytics
description: what you'll do center for customer insight (cci) develops strong know-how on the global market and consumers via various proprietary researches, and we combine proprietary and existing tools to tailor programs. besides, the team has strong capabilities and experience to manage and conduct client-specific researches. as a senior knowledge analyst (ska) within knowledge team in ksa, you will work in a growing global team , with primary focus on the middle east region and its clientele, providing consumer research expertise and insights whilst working together with case and proposal teams to provide knowledge assets, analysis and expert advisory. you’ll serve as a thought partner and content expert to case teams and topic/sector leaders, helping structure and solve complex issues. you will be responsible for designing of research studies – questionnaire preparation, survey execution, data quality management – monitoring as well as conducting surveys when needed, field work management, agency management, etc. you will provide analytical services (e.g. qualitative and quantitative data analysis, comfortable with spss and data analytics techniques such as segmentation, regression, cluster, etc.) you will also help design and execute qualitative research studies – discussion guide preparation, moderation of in-depth interviews and focus group discussion, field work management, agency management, etc. additionally, you will support the team in developing existing & new intellectual property and knowledge assets. you will work on commercialization efforts for the topic/sector, in conjunction with business leaders, supporting marketing efforts, conferences and publications. as a senior knowledge analyst, you will assist with on-boarding, training and guiding junior colleagues and share best practices within the team, as needed you will also own daily basis support workflow, activities, and output of the cci coe, supporting teams on ad hoc requests and deliver on need ensuring highest quality response. #cf #bcgcareers #bcglife #li-es3 you're good at solving client problems through formulating relevant research and/or analytical approaches in your area of expertise communicating with case teams and clients team members, in a credible and confident way working collaboratively and effectively in a group dynamic often virtual, proficient in agile ways of working being flexible and bringing a curious and creative mindset, open to new things and able to propose innovative ideas navigating complexity and ambiguity you bring (experience & qualifications) 3-5 years of working experience in consumer research firms, or experience with other companies / firms focused on consumer insights bachelor/master degree from a reputed university with demonstrated academic achievements expertise in primary market research for both quantitative and qualitative methodologies, in both b2b and b2c environments deep experience in questionnaire and interview guide development expertise in statistical techniques - quantitative data modelling, regression, maxdiff and turf analysis, clustering models, customer segmentation analysis amongst other prominent quantitative techniques exposure to different qualitative research techniques: focus group (offline and virtual), in-depth/expert interviews, ethnography etc. adept at analyzing and interpreting data to identify patterns and solutions, including from surveys and focus group transcripts proficiency with ms-office suite, spss and exposure to any other data analysis tools hands-on experience of mr-specific programming and visualization tools is an added advantage good understanding of working with online panels outstanding interpersonal and communication skills to interact with internal and external stakeholder while working in a global collaborative team environment native fluency (reading, writing and speaking) in arabic language, and fluent in english as a senior knowledge analyst, you will collaborate with global topic leads and colleagues across bcg to bring expertise and capabilities to the service of our internal and external clients. our team is made up of a diverse pool of knowledge positions that allow us to pursue exciting, innovative knowledge careers. additional information the knowledge team (kt) is a group of functional and/or industry experts leveraging deep domain knowledge to enable insight for case teams and clients. kt members are affiliated to bcg practice areas, plugged into the strategic agenda and building and deploying leading edge ip data tools/assets to deliver insight. bcg's knowledge team members are staffed on cases and help co-create insights with case teams and clients through expert perspectives on industry trends, delivery of proprietary data or tools in a particular function and complex research and analysis of market information. kt members also support the pa’s business development and proposals and help to organize and codify the knowledge that enables bcg to deliver superior business value for its clients.

name: Lucidya
title: Digital Analyst, Strategic Accounts
description: lucidya is one of the fastest growing saas startups in the world & the leading customer experience management tool geared towards arabic language. by leveraging ai, machine learning & big data technologies, we are on a mission of empowering businesses in the mena region to understand and better serve their customers using our media & customer intelligence products. with an hq in riyadh and offices in different countries in the world, we are funded by the most reputable investors in the region and scaling rapidly to meet the increasing demand of our products. come and join the startup that has been named by world economic forum as one the most promising startups in mena region … be part of the history we are making. we are looking for an observant and data-driven social media analyst to judge and evaluate the success of social media and web presence of a brand/campaign/initiative by looking at posts' metrics. as a social media analyst at lucidya, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the success of our clients' social media campaigns and initiatives. your expertise will provide critical insights and feedback primarily to social media and customer experience (cx) directors. by analyzing the performance of social media platforms and related content, you will ensure that our solution is both impactful and adaptive. this is a project-based role where you'll be focused on a single account, allowing you to dedicate your full attention to one project rather than juggling multiple ones. roles & responsibilities: analyzing social media post metrics. researching new social media trends and tools. keeping up to date of current events and pop culture to better understand user behavior. monitoring social media channels for mentions of company or brand names to identify potential customer service issues or opportunities for increased brand awareness. providing constructive criticism to content creators to help them make improvements. creating reports with analytics findings and recommendations for internal (sales, marketing..etc.) or external (customers, prospects) requests review reports for accuracy and consistency proofread for grammar, spelling, and formatting. cross-reference data points and calculation. check references, citations, and hyperlinks. maintain consistent visual and content standards. requirements excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. ability to contribute both independently and as part of a team. in-depth understanding of how to read and interpret data. the ability to analyze data (specifically related to user behavior and engagement). excellent communication skills. the ability to provide constructive criticism. strong professional writing skills. ability to identify target audience preferences and trends. strong time management skills. research skills. great attention to detail.

name: Infinium Associates
title: Investment and Asset Manager
description: the investment and asset manager is responsible for managing the company's investment and asset strategies and portfolios. they provide strategic vision, oversee investment and asset decisions, ensure portfolio diversification, and strive to maximize returns while managing risks. this role requires a deep understanding of financial markets, economic trends, and investment tools, guiding the company toward optimal investment opportunities. key responsibilities 1. developing and implementing investment and asset strategy: o develop and effectively communicate the company's investment and asset strategy, staying aligned with market trends, economic forecasts, and client goals. o ensure the effective execution of the strategy, making tactical decisions to optimize portfolio performance and achieve maximum returns. o manage investment portfolios, ensuring diversification across asset classes, sectors, and geographies to minimize risk and enhance potential returns. o implement robust risk management strategies, identifying and mitigating potential risks through proactive portfolio diversification and risk assessment. o weight: 30% 2. market research and analysis: omonitor the performance of various investment strategies against key benchmarks such as market indices or industry standards. oparticipate in research activities, including analyzing economic trends, industry developments, and company performance. oconduct extensive market research and analysis, evaluating economic indicators, industry trends, and geopolitical events to identify investment opportunities and threats. ouse data-driven insights to make informed investment decisions, adapting to dynamic market conditions. oweight: 30% 3.customer relationship management: o act as an intermediary between the organization and external investment managers. o maintain client relationships, understanding their investment goals, risk tolerance, and preferences. o provide personalized investment solutions and recommendations, meeting client needs and ensuring alignment with their financial goals. o weight: 20% 4. team leadership and development: o lead and guide the investment and asset team, providing strategic direction, mentoring, and support in investment analysis and decision-making. o encourage continuous professional development within the team, fostering a culture of learning and innovation. o weight: 10% 5. compliance and ethical standards: o ensure compliance with applicable laws, regulations, ethical standards, and licensing requirements. o maintain high ethical standards in investment practices, ensuring transparency, integrity, and client trust. o weight: 10% educational qualifications: o master's degree in finance, economics, business administration, or a related field. 2. professional certifications: o chartered financial analyst (cfa) o certified investment management analyst (cima) job type: full-time pay: ﷼30,000.00 - ﷼50,000.00 per month

name: ITT, Inc.
title: Financial Analyst
description: position summary: reporting directly to financial controller, the financial analyst shall be responsible for all areas relating to financial and management accounts at the facility. essential responsibilities: oversee day-to-day bookkeeping functions of the operations, including the preparation of local statutory accounts. maintenance of a clean set of balance sheet supporting records (called the ownership book), detailing every item on the balance sheets. the ownership book to be updated on a monthly basis. supervision of the reconciliation of all bank accounts and inter-company accounts every month end and to initiate the adjusting entries where appropriate. timely submission of all monthly financial reports as well as ad-hoc reports required by corporate headquarters, or as directed. inventory and work in progress. ensure that the cost build-up of on-going jobs reviewed regularly and to highlight to controller & general manager any potential overrun of job costs against the budgeted estimates. organizing and overseeing fixed assets physical verifications and well as the custody of inventory. ensuring that warranty reserves as well as excess and obsolescence reserves are adequate and made in accordance with itt policy. preparation of the annual strategic plans and budget as well and regular updates of forecasts and cash flows or any other reports besides the monthly balance sheet and profit and loss statements, or as directed credit approval and control and debt collection, ensuring that bad debt reserves made in accordance with itt policy. responsible for the documenting, updating and maintenance of hard and soft copies of all financial control narratives, flowcharts and sarbanes oxley act (soa) control templates, including the uploading of most up to date soa documentation onto the itt intranet. maintaining standard costing records. cost and management reports. submission of monthly commentary on the state of the business and performance of the unit each month end. billing to the customers according to the vat requirement and passing the same to the concerned persons for dispatch and proper accounting. supervise review supplier invoices and other invoices with the po and grn. oversee due dates for supplier and service providers invoices and issuance of the payment to them on timely basis. maintenance of statistical report showing the monthly payment details for all the recurring payments like telephone, rent etc. ensure accuracy and reliability of soars data preparation of the annual strategic plans and budget as well and regular updates of forecasts and cash flows or any other reports besides the monthly balance sheet and profit and loss statements, or as directed. preparation of mis reports. preparation and submission or various statutory reports as per the requirement. position requirements: education: bachelor’s degree (or local equivalent) in finance & accounting or economics. an advanced degree preferred. experience: minimum 10 years’ experience in finance/cost accounting preferably with a multinational manufacturing company other skills/knowledge/experience: excellent computer literacy (ms office, profound knowledge of excel, one stream, sap & power bi exposure would be considered an asset) knowledge of us gaap and/or ifrs would be considered an asset the incumbent must have a good command of english language. a second language (arabic) would be a plus. excellent skills in financial analysis, analytical experience, problem solving. strong organizational skills. pc skills including spreadsheet, presentation software and word processing are necessary. resistance to pressure & tolerance to tight deadlines core competencies = our principles in action excellent communication skills – written and verbal. strong work ethic excellent analytical skills outstanding leadership and presentation skills global perspective initiative and good independent judgment

with investment analysis. ability to develop and maintain working relationships with key investors across the gcc. responsibility for deal and capital trackers as well as other databases as required.
